properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 1132 PM EDT...a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line
extending from near Mayfield to near Edgehill to Wrightsville to
Cedar Grove...and moving northeast at 25 mph.

HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of these storms include
Sandersville, Soperton, Louisville, Mount Vernon, Wrightsville,
Warrenton, Gibson, East Dublin, Wrens, Wadley, Davisboro, Tennille,
Glenwood, Adrian, Harrison, Stapleton, Ailey, Higgston, Bartow and
Avera.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 11:09PM EDT expiring June 30 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont...
Southern Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont...
Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont...
Northwestern Washington County in central Vermont...
Southwestern Franklin County in northwestern Vermont...

* Until 215 AM EDT

* At 1108 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to
two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is expected
to begin shortly.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport,
Burlington, Morrisville, Johnson Village, Cambridge, Winooski,
Waterbury Village, Westford, Hyde Park, Colchester, Essex Junction
Village, Fairfax, Williston, Belvidere Center, Georgia, Waterville,
Hinesburg and St. George.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: Flash Flood Warning this area til 2:15 AM EDT. Avoid flood areas. Check local media. -NWS

properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 10:15PM EDT expiring June 30 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Clinton County in northern New York...
Eastern Franklin County in northern New York...
Northern Essex County in northern New York...

* Until 215 AM EDT

* At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to
two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is expected
to begin shortly.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Plattsburgh International Airport, Saranac Lake, Adirondack
Regional Airport, Plattsburgh, Lake Placid, Peru, Beekmantown,
Schuyler Falls, Saranac, Altona, Willsboro, Wilmington, Ellenburg
Depot, Churubusco, Au Sable Forks, Keeseville, Jay In Essex County,
Lyon Mountain, Clayburg and Merrill.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to one and a half inches are
possible in the warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: Flash Flood Warning this area til 2:15 AM EDT. Avoid flood areas. Check local media. -NWS

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 8:10PM MDT expiring July 4 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Snowmelt in...
Northwestern Washakie County in central Wyoming...

* Until 800 PM MDT Tuesday

* Emergency management reported ongoing minor flooding along the Big
Horn River in Washakie County especially where 15 Mile Creek
enters the Big Horn River near Worland.

* High reservoir releases from Boysen will keep the Big Horn River
nearly steady through the long 4th of July weekend. The Big Horn
River at 7 PM Thursday was at 11.3 feet, and is expected to vary
between 11.1 and 11.6 feet through the 4th of July. Flood stage at
this location is 10.5 feet.
properties.instruction:
Please stay away from the rivers! The water is swift, cold, and
dangerous. Do not stand on the river bank as the river may have
eroded away the land beneath the bank. Never play, swim, walk, or
drive in flood waters!

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 4:23PM PDT expiring July 2 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Reno has extended the

* Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
Snowmelt in...
Southern Mono County in northern California...

* Until 900 PM PDT Sunday

* Well above average temperatures will produce increased high
elevation snowmelt again this weekend. This will lead to minor
flooding along creeks and streams in the advisory area through
this weekend. Stream flows can be highest overnight as daytime
snowmelt works its way downstream.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated. Be alert
if camping or hiking near streams as they are running fast and cold.
Most stream flows peak during the night or early morning hours so
don't camp close to streams.

properties.instruction:

fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to
the public.

properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued June 29 at 6:07PM EDT expiring June 30 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
properties.description:
* LOCATIONS...ATLANTIC OCEAN BEACHES.

* RIP CURRENT RISK...HIGH.

* SURF HEIGHT...2 TO 4 FT THIS EVENING...INCREASING TO 4 TO 5 FT ON FRIDAY.

* TIMING...THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING.
properties.instruction:
RIP CURRENTS ARE POWERFUL CHANNELS OF WATER FLOWING QUICKLY AWAY
FROM SHORE...WHICH OCCUR MOST OFTEN AT LOW SPOTS OR BREAKS IN
SANDBARS AND NEAR STRUCTURES SUCH AS GROINS...JETTIES...AND
PIERS. TALK TO LIFEGUARDS AND BEACH OFFICIALS TO LEARN ABOUT ANY
SURF HAZARDS AND HEED THEIR ADVICE. PAY ATTENTION TO FLAGS AND
POSTED SIGNS AND SWIM IN LIFE GUARDED AREAS.

SWIM NEAR A LIFEGUARD. IF CAUGHT IN A RIP CURRENT...RELAX AND
FLOAT...AND DO NOT SWIM AGAINST THE CURRENT.  IF ABLE...SWIM IN A
DIRECTION FOLLOWING THE SHORELINE. IF UNABLE TO ESCAPE...FACE THE
SHORE AND CALL OR WAVE FOR HELP.

NWSheadline: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING

properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 29 at 4:45PM CDT expiring June 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Kansas City/Pleasant Hill has
expanded the

* Flash Flood Watch to include portions of east central Kansas
and Missouri, including the following areas, in east central
Kansas, Miami. In Missouri, Cass, Johnson MO, Lafayette, and
Saline.

* Through Friday morning

* Additional rounds of thunderstorms will lead to periods of
heavy rainfall, which could result in flash flooding from this
morning through Friday morning. Rainfall totals will approach
2 to 4 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. This
rainfall will fall on already saturated ground where
widespread 4 to 8 inches has already fallen.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

* Flood Advisory for...

Douglas County in western Nevada...
Central Lyon County in west central Nevada...

* Until 315 PM PDT Saturday

releases from Bridgeport Reservoir. This reach has been upgraded
to a Flood Warning. See that product for more details.

week and minor flooding in the lower parts of Antelope Valley is

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 1:10PM MDT expiring June 30 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
Big Wood River at Hailey AFFECTING Blaine County

Cooler temperatures from yesterday and today have dropped
the river to around 5 feet today. Expect the river to
continue to gradually decline through Sunday. Warmer
temperatures later this weekend into next week will
keep the river at elevated flows and potentialy cause a
small rise next week.
The Flood Advisory continues for
The Big Wood River at Hailey
* until Friday afternoon.
* At 12 PM Thursday the stage was 5.1 feet.
* Bankfull Stage is 5.5 feet.
* Flood Stage is 6.0 feet.
* Forecast...The River will continue to gradually fall
through the weekend. Then the river will likely stop dropping
and keep a steady flow, if not increase slightly, early next
week with warmer temperatures coming.
* Impact...At 6.0 feet...Minor flooding is likely near the Della View
Subdivision in Hailey.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Safety Message...Persons near the River should be aware of the
expected high water and take action to protect property.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 1:45PM CDT expiring June 30 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has extended the

* Flood Warning for...
Linn County in north central Missouri...
Grundy County in north central Missouri...
Southern Mercer County in north central Missouri...
Southern Sullivan County in north central Missouri...
Harrison County in north central Missouri...
Nodaway County in northwestern Missouri...
Western Macon County in north central Missouri...
Northeastern Andrew County in northwestern Missouri...
Northern Livingston County in north central Missouri...
Northern Chariton County in north central Missouri...
Southwestern Adair County in northeastern Missouri...
Worth County in northwestern Missouri...
Daviess County in north central Missouri...
Gentry County in northwestern Missouri...
Northeastern Atchison County in northwestern Missouri...
Northeastern DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri...

* Until 330 PM CDT Friday

* At 140 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding throughout
the flood warning area with many roads closed and multiple water
resuces. 6-10 inches of rain have fallen over the last 24 hours.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Maryville, Chillicothe, Trenton, Brookfield, Bethany, Marceline,
Milan, Gallatin, Albany, Stanberry, Princeton, King City, Grant
City, Burlington Junction, Hopkins, Jamesport, Bucklin, Ridgeway,
Meadville and Ravenwood.

Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the
warned area over the next 24 hours.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying
spots.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.

strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 7:22PM MDT expiring June 30 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Pocatello has extended the

* Flood Warning for...
Snowmelt in...
Southern Custer County in central Idaho...
Northwestern Blaine County in central Idaho...

* Until 230 PM MDT Friday

* Cooler temperatures continue on Thursday and will provide less
snow melt. This is a temporary slowing of the flows on local
rivers and streams. Temperatures will warm again this Friday
through the weekend.

Flooding remains possible along and near the following waterways:
* Big Wood River near Hailey and Warm Springs
* Trail Creek through Ketchum
* Big Lost River above Mackay Reservoir
properties.instruction:
Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams.
Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting St. Tammany...Washington...
Hancock and Pearl River Counties/Parishes

Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting St. Tammany...Hancock and
Pearl River Counties/Parishes
The Flood Warning continues for
The Pearl River Near Pearl River.
* until further notice.
* At  7:00 PM Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to a stage of 15.9 feet
by Friday morning.
* Impact...At 16.0 feet...Lower portions of streets in River Gardens
Subdivision will begin to flood. Secondary roads to the river and
throughout Honey Island Swamp will remain inundated. Property in
the vicinity of the gage is flooded threatening about 20 homes
along the left bank. The Bogue Chitto National Wildlife Refuge will
be closed to hunting at the 15.5 foot stage.
* Impact...At 15.5 feet...Secondary roads to the river and throughout
Honey Island Swamp are inundated. Property in the vicinity of the
gage is flooded threatening about 20 homes along the left bank. The
Bogue Chitto National Wildlife Refuge will be closed to hunting at
the 15.5 foot stage.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has occurred along with
anticipated rain for the next 12 hours. Adjustments to the forecasts
will be made if additional heavy rainfall occurs.

Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Remember, two feet of
rushing water can carry away most vehicles including pickups.  Turn
around and don't drown!

A followup product will be issued later. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio, local tv and radio stations...or your cable provider, for the
latest information. The latest graphical hydrologic information can
also be found at Weather.Gov.

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 5:56PM PDT expiring July 1 at 9:45AM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Reno has extended the

* Flood Advisory for...
Rain and Snowmelt in...
North central Pershing County in west central Nevada...

* Until 945 AM PDT Saturday

* The Humboldt River near Imlay was near 10.3 feet on June 28. The
river above Rye Patch Reservoir continues slowly falling.

* Minor flooding of the Tungsten Road south of the river between the
river and the Pit Taylor Canal is expected to continue. About 8
inches of water was reported over the road earlier on the
afternoon on June 28. Some minor lowland flooding is also possible
near the river from the Humboldt County line to Rye Patch
Reservoir.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 2:47PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
Walker River Near Mason affecting Lyon County

For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason...
Minor flooding is occurring...with Moderate flooding forecast.

Increased releases from Bridgeport Reservoir will lead to minor to
moderate flooding along the East Walker River. Flows have decreased
somewhat with depleting snow contributing area and recent more
seasonal temperatures on the West Walker River, but still remain
just below flood stages.

As a result, flows into and below the Mason-Yerington area on the
mainstem Walker River will remain high through the week. Flows are
expected to remain near current levels until late this week when the
increased flows from the East Walker make their way into the Mason
Valley. At that time flows are expected to climb above earlier
crests to levels near moderate flood stage at Mason. Flows will also
increase at Wabuska and down to Weber Reservoir by the weekend and
into early next week.

Any changes to upstream reservoir management will result in changes
to the river forecasts.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

These river forecasts are based on forecast rainfall and temperature
conditions at time of issuance. If actual conditions vary from these
forecasts...river conditions will vary accordingly. River forecasts
include current and planned reservoir releases.

Do not drive cars through flooded areas as rushing water
can easily sweep a car away...

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 12:48PM PDT expiring July 1 at 12:45PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Snowmelt in...
Northern Mono County in northern California...
Southern Lyon County in west central Nevada...

* Until 1245 PM PDT Saturday

* Releases from Bridgeport Reservoir will be increased today to make
room for additional high releases from Twin Lakes Reservoir
upstream. Flows below Bridgeport will lead to flooding of
agricultural areas, rural roads including but not limited to the
East Walker Road, and may impact property accesses.

* Specific impacts are highly uncertain, but be prepared for very
high flows and impacts to low lying areas around the river. These
flows along the East Walker will be the highest flows so far this
year and the highest flows experienced along this reach in over 15
years.
properties.instruction:
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where
you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become
killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or
creeks.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 5:51PM PDT expiring July 2 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
West Walker River Near Coleville affecting Mono County
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada...

Walker River Near Mason affecting Lyon County

Temperatures returning to near normal and depleting snow contribution
area will decrease headwater flows slowly this week in the upper
portions of the Walker River basin. This will result in slowly
decreasing flows along the West Fork of the Walker River.

Increased releases from Bridgeport Reservoir will maintain high flowson
the East Walker River. Increased releases from Topaz Lake will also continue the high flows on the West Walker River below Topaz Lake.

As a result, flows into and below the Mason-Yerington area on the
mainstem Walker River will remain high through the week. Flows will remain high through Mason and Yerington with levels possible reaching the crest seen on June 22nd. Based on the latest river data, continued prolonged minor flooding is likely through Mason/Yerington with moderate flooding below Yerington through the Wabuska area.
The Flood Warning continues for
The West Walker River Near Coleville.
* until late Saturday night.
* At  5:30 PM Tuesday the stage was 5.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 6.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late Tuesday evening  and
continue to rise to near 6.2 feet by early Wednesday morning. More
peaks are expected overnight Wednesday...Thursday and Friday.
* Impact...At 6.0 feet...FLood stage.  Minor flooding of lowlands...
pasture & rural roads in West Walker River Canyon and Antelope
Valley...including Walker...Coleville and Topaz California.
